db:info.db:title: AbstractAxis3D QML Type
db:info.db:edition: Qt Data Visualization | Commercial or GPLv3

db:abstract.db:para: A base type for the axes of a graph.
This type was introduced in QtDataVisualization 1.0.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This type is uncreatable, but contains properties that are exposed via subtypes.
For AbstractAxis3D enums, see QAbstract3DAxis::AxisOrientation and QAbstract3DAxis::AxisType.

db:section.db:title: autoAdjustRange : bool
db:section.db:para: Defines whether the axis will automatically adjust the range so that all data fits in it.

db:section.db:title: labelAutoRotation : real
db:section.db:para: The maximum angle the labels can autorotate when the camera angle changes. The angle can be between 0 and 90, inclusive. The default value is 0. If the value is 0, axis labels do not automatically rotate. If the value is greater than zero, labels attempt to orient themselves toward the camera, up to the specified angle.

db:note.db:para: Setting this property for ValueAxis3D does nothing, as it generates labels automatically.

db:section.db:title: max : real
db:section.db:para: The maximum value on the axis. When setting this property, the minimum value is adjusted if necessary, to ensure that the range remains valid.

db:section.db:title: min : real
db:section.db:para: The minimum value on the axis. When setting this property, the maximum value is adjusted if necessary, to ensure that the range remains valid.

db:section.db:title: titleFixed : bool
db:section.db:para: If true, axis titles in the primary graph view will be rotated towards the camera similarly to the axis labels. If false, axis titles are only rotated around their axis but are not otherwise oriented towards the camera. This property does not have any effect if the labelAutoRotation property value is zero. Default value is true.

db:section.db:title: titleVisible : bool
db:section.db:para: Defines whether the axis title is visible in the primary graph view.
